instructions.name: commit_vote
docs: Instruction handler: Commit a vote on a submission within a topic
This creates a vote commitment without revealing the actual vote choice.
The actual vote is hashed with a nonce for privacy during the commit phase.

accounts.name: user_profile
docs: Validator's profile (needed for constraints and rep_ata check)

accounts.name: user_topic_balance
docs: Validator's topic-specific balance account for this topic.
MUST be initialized first. Only used if is_permanent_rep is false.

accounts.name: validator_rep_ata
docs: Validator's permanent Rep ATA (user-owned).
Only needed if is_permanent_rep is true. We pass it regardless for simplicity,
but only read its balance conditionally in the instruction.

accounts.name: validator
docs: The validator committing the vote

instructions.name: create_topic
docs: Instruction handler: Create a new topic
This creates a new topic that submissions can be added to.
Only the protocol authority can create topics.

instructions.name: create_user_ata
docs: Instruction handler: explicitly create user's ATA for permanent tokens (Align, Rep)
This does NOT use `init_if_needed`. Instead, it does a CPI to the associated_token::create method.
If the ATA already exists, this transaction will fail (unless you do extra checks).

accounts.name: state
docs: The state account containing all mint references

accounts.name: payer
docs: The person paying for creating the ATA

accounts.name: user
docs: The user for whom we want to create an ATA

accounts.name: user_profile
docs: The user's profile, needs mut to store the new ATA address

accounts.name: mint
docs: The mint for which we want the user's ATA (only permanent token mints)

accounts.name: user_ata
docs: The Associated Token Account (will be created if it doesn't exist)
We do not use `init_if_needed`; we do a CPI call to the ATA program explicitly below.

accounts.name: system_program
docs: Programs

instructions.name: create_user_profile
docs: Instruction handler: Create a user profile for tracking reputation
This creates a new PDA account to store the user's reputation metrics

accounts.name: user_profile
docs: The user profile account to be initialized.

accounts.name: user
docs: The user creating the profile (payer and owner)

accounts.name: system_program
docs: System program - required for account initialization

instructions.name: create_user_temp_align_account
docs: Instruction handler: create protocol-owned tempAlign token account for a user
This creates a token account for tempAlign tokens that is owned by the protocol (state PDA)
rather than the user, allowing the protocol to burn tokens without requiring user signatures.

accounts.name: state
docs: The state account containing protocol configuration

accounts.name: payer
docs: The payer for the transaction

accounts.name: user
docs: The user for whom we're creating the account (but not the account owner)

accounts.name: user_profile
docs: The user's profile, needs mut to store the new token account address

accounts.name: mint
docs: The mint must be the tempAlign mint

accounts.name: token_account
docs: The token account will be a PDA owned by the program
With the state as the authority, not the user

instructions.name: create_user_temp_rep_account
docs: Instruction handler: create protocol-owned tempRep token account for a user
This creates a token account for tempRep tokens that is owned by the protocol (state PDA)
rather than the user, allowing the protocol to burn tokens without requiring user signatures.

accounts.name: state
docs: The state account containing protocol configuration

accounts.name: payer
docs: The payer for the transaction

accounts.name: user
docs: The user for whom we're creating the account (but not the account owner)

accounts.name: user_profile
docs: The user's profile, needs mut to store the new token account address

accounts.name: mint
docs: The mint must be the tempRep mint

accounts.name: token_account
docs: The token account will be a PDA owned by the program
With the state as the authority, not the user

instructions.name: finalize_submission
docs: Instruction handler: Finalize a submission within a topic after voting
This determines if a submission is accepted or rejected based on voting results.
For accepted submissions, it converts contributor's tempAlign tokens to permanent Align tokens.

accounts.name: contributor_profile
docs: The contributor's user profile (needed for token account constraints)

accounts.name: user_topic_balance
docs: The contributor's topic-specific balance account for this topic.
This holds the tempAlign to potentially convert.

accounts.name: contributor_temp_align_account
docs: The protocol-owned tempAlign token account for the contributor (for burning)

accounts.name: contributor_align_ata
docs: The contributor's ATA for permanent alignment tokens (regular user-owned ATA)

accounts.name: temp_align_mint
docs: The tempAlign mint (for burning)

accounts.name: align_mint
docs: The Align mint (for minting)

accounts.name: authority
docs: The authority calling this instruction (can be any user, acts as payer)

instructions.name: finalize_vote
docs: Instruction handler: Finalize a validator's vote after submission has been finalized
This processes the token rewards or penalties for a validator based on their vote:
- For correct votes: Burn tempRep tokens and mint permanent Rep tokens
- For incorrect votes: Just burn tempRep tokens with no replacement
- No penalty for permanent Rep tokens used for voting

accounts.name: validator_profile
docs: The validator's user profile (profile whose vote is being finalized)

accounts.name: user_topic_balance
docs: Validator's topic-specific balance account for this topic.
Used only if is_permanent_rep was false during commit.

accounts.name: validator_temp_rep_account
docs: The protocol-owned tempRep token account for this validator (for burning)

accounts.name: validator_rep_ata
docs: The validator's ATA for permanent reputation tokens (for minting)
This remains user-owned since permanent tokens belong to users

accounts.name: temp_rep_mint
docs: The tempRep mint (for burning)

accounts.name: rep_mint
docs: The Rep mint (for minting)

accounts.name: authority
docs: The signer finalizing the vote (can be anyone, not just the validator)

instructions.name: initialize_align_mint
docs: Instruction handler: initialize align_mint (Part 2b)

instructions.name: initialize_rep_mint
docs: Instruction handler: initialize rep_mint (Part 2d)

instructions.name: initialize_state
docs: Instruction handler: initialize the protocol state (Part 1)

instructions.name: initialize_temp_align_mint
docs: Instruction handler: initialize temp_align_mint (Part 2a)

instructions.name: initialize_temp_rep_mint
docs: Instruction handler: initialize temp_rep_mint (Part 2c)

instructions.name: initialize_user_topic_balance
docs: Instruction handler: Initialize a user's topic-specific balance account

accounts.name: user
docs: The user initializing this balance account

accounts.name: user_profile
docs: The user's profile (needed for constraint check, maybe not mutation)

accounts.name: topic
docs: The topic this balance is associated with

accounts.name: user_topic_balance
docs: The user's topic-specific balance account to be initialized.

instructions.name: link_submission_to_topic
docs: Instruction handler: Link an existing submission to a topic
This creates a new SubmissionTopicLink for an existing Submission and Topic,
allowing the submission to be voted on in multiple topics independently.
Anyone can link if they are willing to pay the transaction fee.

accounts.name: submission
docs: The existing submission to link to the topic

accounts.name: submission_topic_link
docs: The link between submission and topic

accounts.name: authority
docs: The user linking the submission to the topic (could be contributor or authority)

instructions.name: request_ai_validation
docs: Instruction handler: Request AI validation for a submission
Allows the original contributor to spend tempRep to have an AI vote on their submission.

accounts.name: submission
docs: The submission made by the requester

accounts.name: topic
docs: The topic the submission belongs to (needed for UserTopicBalance PDA derivation)

accounts.name: submission_topic_link
docs: The link between the submission and the topic

accounts.name: user_topic_balance
docs: User's balance account for this specific topic (to deduct tempRep)

accounts.name: ai_validation_request
docs: The new AI Validation Request account to be created

instructions.name: reveal_vote
docs: Instruction handler: Reveal a previously committed vote
This reveals the actual vote choice and verifies it matches the previously committed hash.
If valid, it adds the voter's voting power to the appropriate yes/no counter.

accounts.name: validator
docs: The validator revealing the vote (must match the original committer)

instructions.name: set_voting_phases
docs: Instruction handler: Set voting phases for a submission-topic link
This allows the protocol authority to manually set timestamps for the commit and reveal phases.
This is primarily intended for testing and administrative purposes.

accounts.name: authority
docs: Only authority can modify phases

instructions.name: stake_topic_specific_tokens
docs: Instruction handler: Stake topic-specific temporary alignment tokens
Burns tempAlign tokens from a specific topic and mints tempRep tokens for that topic

accounts.name: topic
docs: The topic for which tokens are being staked

accounts.name: user_profile
docs: The user's profile, contains references to token accounts

accounts.name: user_topic_balance
docs: The user's topic-specific balance account for this topic.
MUST be initialized separately via `initialize_user_topic_balance` first.

accounts.name: temp_align_mint
docs: The temporary alignment token mint (source tokens to burn)

accounts.name: temp_rep_mint
docs: The temporary reputation token mint (target tokens to mint)

accounts.name: user_temp_align_account
docs: The protocol-owned tempAlign token account for this user (source for burn)

accounts.name: user_temp_rep_account
docs: The protocol-owned tempRep token account for this user (target for mint)

accounts.name: user
docs: The user associated with these tokens, signing the transaction.

accounts.name: token_program
docs: Token program for CPI calls

instructions.name: submit_ai_vote
docs: Instruction handler: Submit AI vote result (called by Oracle)
Allows the authorized off-chain Oracle to submit the AI's decision, adding voting power.

accounts.name: ai_validation_request
docs: The AI Request being fulfilled.

accounts.name: submission_topic_link
docs: The SubmissionTopicLink being voted on.

instructions.name: submit_data_to_topic
docs: Instruction handler: Submit data to a specific topic
This creates a submission and links it to a topic, setting up the voting phases.

accounts.name: temp_align_mint
docs: The temporary alignment token mint, must be mutable for minting

accounts.name: contributor_temp_align_account
docs: The protocol-owned tempAlign token account for this contributor

accounts.name: submission
docs: The new Submission account - Seeds now use user key + user counter index

accounts.name: submission_topic_link
docs: The link between submission and topic - Seeds use the derived submission key

accounts.name: contributor_profile
docs: The contributor's user profile (must exist)

accounts.name: user_topic_balance
docs: The UserTopicBalance account for this contributor and topic.
MUST be initialized separately via `initialize_user_topic_balance` first.

accounts.name: contributor
docs: The user making the submission

instructions.name: update_tokens_to_mint
docs: Instruction handler: update the number of tokens to mint for each submission
